content:
Customer: Hi, I'm calling about my DirectTV bill. I was charged for a service I didn't order and I want to cancel it.

Customer Service Representative: Hi, I'm sorry to hear that. My name is [Name] and I'll be happy to help you with your issue. Can you please tell me more about what's happening?

Customer: Yeah, I was charged for a service that I never ordered. I don't even know what it is. I want to cancel the service and get a refund.

Customer Service Representative: I understand how frustrating that must be. Let me see if I can help you with that. Can you please confirm your account information for me so I can look into this further?

Customer: Sure, my account number is [Account Number] and my name is [Name].

Customer Service Representative: Thank you for providing that information. I'm going to check on the status of your account and see what might have happened with the charge for the service. Can you please hold for just a moment while I do that?

Customer: Sure, thank you.

Customer Service Representative: Alright, I've checked on your account and it looks like the service was added by mistake. I apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. I'm going to go ahead and cancel the service and refund the charge. You should see the credit on your next bill.

Customer: Oh, thank you so much! I really appreciate your help.

Customer Service Representative: You're welcome. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

Customer: No, that was the only issue I was having. Thank you again for your help.

Customer Service Representative: You're welcome. Thank you for choosing DirectTV and have a great day.

Documentation:

Customer: [Name], [Account Number]

Issue: Charged for service that was not ordered.

Resolution: Service was cancelled and charge was refunded. Credit will be applied to next bill.

Followed Apple's style guide by:

* Apologizing for the inconvenience and taking ownership of the issue.
* Asking for confirmation of account information before looking into the issue further.
* Providing a resolution and checking to see if there were any other issues.

The customer service representative followed the Apple style guide by being empathetic, taking ownership of the issue, and providing a solution. They also ensured that the customer's account information was confirmed before looking into the issue further and checked to see if there were any other issues the customer needed assistance with.
